name: Oxfam America
mission: Oxfam works with local organizations, providing funds and empowering poor people to play a central role in the development of their families, communities, and regions.
theoryOfChange: Oxfam America has a published 'Oxfam America 2030 Strategy Framework' which guides their work towards 2030. This framework leverages their resources to collaborate and innovate globally, radically shifting resources and power to people experiencing marginalization. It focuses on fighting inequality and is complemented by three-year plans. Additionally, Oxfam America has an innovative approach to monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) with a dedicated department and rigorous systems for all long-term programs, major campaigns, and key innovation projects.

all_citations.claim: Oxfam America holds a Charity Navigator score of 99.33333333333333/100 and demonstrates high financial health.

all_citations.claim: Oxfam America offers various giving methods for general charitable support and Sadaqah.
The organization reported total revenue of $83,115,051 and a program expense ratio of 72.3%.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Oxfam America earns a GMG score of 71/100 due to its exceptional financial transparency and proven track record in humanitarian relief, though its alignment score reflects a medium fit for specific donor segments.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing direct donor alignment for specific niche audiences
Increasing the program expense ratio beyond the current 72.3% to maximize direct service delivery

dimension_explanations.alignment: Oxfam America shows medium alignment for Muslim donors as a Sadaqah-eligible organization focused on urgent humanitarian causes [6]. Its long-standing track record in international relief and economic justice aligns with general charitable values, supported by high data confidence and transparent financial reporting [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of aid and legislative advocacy, such as securing legislative amendments in Tanzania and training journalists in Ghana to improve governance [3][5]. With a total revenue of $83,115,051, the charity maintains a program expense ratio of 72.3%, directing significant resources toward its core mission of poverty alleviation [1][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Oxfam America empowers local communities to lead their own development through international relief and economic justice initiatives.
strengths: High financial health and accountability rating of 99.99.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator
Strong working capital reserve of 8.0 months to ensure operational stability
Efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.19 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Oxfam America is a global organization that partners with local groups to provide lifesaving support and funds, ensuring poor people play a central role in community development [2][6]. The organization operates with a focus on international relief and economic justice, maintaining high standards of financial accountability and transparency [1][7].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Oxfam America earns a GMG score of 71/100 due to its exceptional financial transparency and proven track record in humanitarian relief, though its alignment score reflects a medium fit for specific donor segments.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="18">program expense ratio of 72.3%</cite> is below the <cite id="19">peer median of 89.7%</cite> for humanitarian organizations.
The organization has experienced a <cite id="20">3-year revenue CAGR of -9.1%</cite>, indicating a contraction in funding that may impact long-term scaling.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high governance standards with 100% independent board oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's high <cite id="12">working capital (8 months)</cite> mitigates immediate risks from declining revenue.
risk_factors: <cite id="20">Negative revenue growth (-9.1%)</cite> over the last three years
<cite id="19">Program spending significantly below peer median</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="18">72.3% program expense ratio</cite>, which suggests a higher portion of funds is spent on administration compared to similar large-scale relief groups.

confidence.data_freshness: Data includes 2024 Form 990 and 2024 Audited Financials
confidence.notes: Extremely high data availability with recent audited financials and external impact reports.

alignment.explanation: Oxfam provides a <cite id="7">strong fit for donors interested in Muslim-majority regions</cite> like Gaza and Afghanistan, though it lacks specific faith-based designations.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be strengthened by <cite id="23">highlighting the humanitarian dimensions</cite> of their work in underserved Muslim-majority populations.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Oxfam due to its <cite id="15">fully independent board</cite>, <cite id="11">Platinum Candid status</cite>, and <cite id="21">audited financial statements</cite> that confirm high governance standards.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already high; maintaining this requires continued <cite id="11">annual outcome reporting through Candid</cite>.

impact.explanation: Operations are effective with a <cite id="22">cost per beneficiary of $79.01</cite>, which is considered excellent for complex humanitarian work.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the charity should aim to <cite id="18">increase its program expense ratio</cite> closer to the industry standard of 75%.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and published evaluations

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Empowers local organizations by providing direct funding for community-led development.

rich_narrative.headline: Oxfam America empowers local communities to lead their own development through international relief and economic justice initiatives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-standing institutional stability and want to support systemic change through both direct aid and policy advocacy in global crisis zones.
donor_motivations: Want to support established organizations with deep roots in local communities
Value high transparency and independent board oversight
Interested in addressing the root causes of poverty through economic justice
Prefer giving sadaqah to a multi-sectoral international NGO
giving_considerations: A significant portion of the budget (over 30%) goes to non-programmatic costs
The organization is currently seeing a decline in total annual revenue
Impact is achieved through a mix of direct delivery and sub-granting to local partners
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking a 100% donation model or those specifically looking to fulfill Zakat obligations through a faith-certified pathway.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="25">verified outcome metrics</cite> and multiple <cite id="13">external project evaluations</cite> showing legislative and social impact.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Oxfam utilizes an integrated approach to combat poverty by <cite id="24">empowering poor people to play a central role</cite> in their own development while advocating for systemic policy shifts.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that interventions like training journalists or passing laws lead to actual poverty reduction.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With <cite id="20">revenue declining by 9.1%</cite>, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding to restore program scales.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="1">80+ year history</cite> and a <cite id="8">highly efficient fundraising cost of $0.19 per $1</cite>.
similar_orgs: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

similar_organizations.name: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

strengths.detail: Oxfam holds a <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="4">near-perfect Charity Navigator rating</cite>, reflecting rigorous governance standards.
The organization maintains <cite id="12">8.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer to sustain programs during economic volatility.
Evaluations show tangible systemic wins, such as <cite id="13">two new laws passed with CSO input</cite> in Ghana and <cite id="14">legislative amendments adopted</cite> in Tanzania.
strengths.point: Proven Impact in Advocacy and Policy

strengths_deep_dive: Oxfam America's strength lies in its ability to combine large-scale resource mobilization with localized execution. By maintaining <cite id="15">100% independent board members</cite>, the organization ensures objective oversight of its <cite id="5">$83.1 million budget</cite>. Their impact is not merely anecdotal; they track specific outcomes such as <cite id="16">CSO capacity ratings</cite> and <cite id="17">digital platform engagement</cite> in Mozambique, demonstrating a commitment to data-driven development that goes beyond simple aid delivery.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1942</cite>, Oxfam America has established itself as a cornerstone of global humanitarian efforts, focusing on <cite id="2">lifesaving support, economic justice, and climate action</cite>. The organization operates with a dual approach: providing immediate emergency relief while simultaneously <cite id="3">empowering local organizations</cite> to lead long-term development within their own communities. This strategy is backed by a robust financial infrastructure, evidenced by a <cite id="4">99.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. In the 2024 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="5">total revenue of $83,115,051</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="6">$81,728,263 in public contributions</cite>. While its reach is vast, covering regions such as <cite id="7">Gaza, Afghanistan, and Mali</cite>, Oxfam maintains a disciplined fundraising model, spending only <cite id="8">$0.19 to raise every $1</cite>. Beyond direct aid, the organization is a significant grantmaker, distributing <cite id="9">$19,868,856 in total grants</cite> during the last reporting period, with <cite id="10">$19,412,103 directed toward foreign recipients</cite> to support localized humanitarian interventions.
